The main function `nmfbin()` operates on matrices like so:

```{r setup}
library(nmfbin)

# Create a binary matrix for demonstration
V <- matrix(sample(c(0, 1), 100, replace=TRUE), ncol=10)

# Perform NMF
results <- nmfbin(V, k=3, divergence="kl", compute_marginal_divergences=TRUE, init_method="random")
```

The results include divergence measures:

```{r measures}

print(results$final_divergence)
print(results$divergence_reductions)

```
